data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always start with the right side facing forward. The first step is taking 9 steps left. The next step is taking 10 steps forward. The next step is taking 9 steps right. The last step is taking 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and turn right are the same thing. If your instructions involve taking 4 steps then you must take 4 steps and turn around and turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 4 steps, it would take you 6 steps, 4 steps would take you 4, and 4 steps would take you 10 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 3 steps to turn around then take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left and turn right. Take a 7 step turn around and take 7 steps return to start point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 8 steps, you’ll be back at the starting point. To take 8 steps, you’ll turn right and once again take 8 steps. If you take 9 steps, you’ll be back at the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

As you travel until you are at the starting point, every step you take leaves you 5 minutes short of a return trip. Take an extra 0 and turn around from where you started in order to return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always face forward. Forward is the direction you want to go in. Left is the opposite direction the forward movement should be. There is a setting-point before any direction changes from left to right that is the setting-point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In order to turn around, you had to take 2 steps first. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot always revert to the starting point while you still face forward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It is a backwards walk. When you take 6 steps backward you are facing towards clockwise. To return to facing forward you take backwards walk which is the same as backward walk. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
This is a total of 3 + 6 + 10 = 35 steps. If we look back at the same point, then we are back at the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To go back to the starting point, you must always face forward. Every time you take a step, turn your body left. If you are changing directions, you need to reverse the direction and turn around until you are facing forward. So, the answer is yes.

For the opposite direction, you would always turn right. So, the answer is yes.

If you turn around and turn left, it will take you 8 steps. Take 4 steps if you are at the starting point. Take 10 steps if you are at the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Let’ s say the first instructions are taken 10 steps and the second instructions are taken 9 steps. So, the answer is No.

Taking 7 steps return you to the original starting point. Turning around takes 9 steps. Returning back to the starting point takes 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

It is far more probable to turn around and take 1 step and back to start. So, the answer is yes.

The starting point are either turn right or turn left with one step. There are only 5 steps involved. So, the answer is No.

If you take an extra step, your back to the starting point. Just 1 step does not do it back to the starting point. Just 1 step does not do it back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

You take 5 steps with 3 steps added, so you got 5 steps without taking 2 steps added. The starting point is 5 steps, so 2 steps is 3 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

To return to the starting point, you must take all the steps required to get there. So, the answer is Yes.

You will only take 1 step forward if you return to the starting point. If you are walking to a side, you will always face the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you start to face forward, you'll go backward. If you start to face left, you will go left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you turn away from a starting point – you always face forward. If you turn right – you always face right. Thus, the answer is Yes.

You can turn right after doing 5 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you take less steps forward. If you always face forward, you take more steps backward. Taking 2 steps backward has no repercussions. So, the answer is No.

The instructions are a series of instructions repeating the same action. The first sequence is three steps. The second sequence is 10 steps. The third sequence is four steps. So, the answer is no.

Turn around and take 9 steps back to the starting point is same. So, the answer is Yes.

In the first 5 steps, you see yourself moving forward and return to the place you started from. The first step says you should face forward so you take 10 steps right. The second step says you should face left so you take 3 steps left. The last step says you should return to the place you started from so you take 3 steps backward. The first step says you should take 10 steps right and return to the place you started from. So, the answer is yes.

The starting point is the same as where you started. 4 steps backward means you are in - or out of - the starting point. If you are facing forward, you always take 5 steps forward. So, the answer is yes.

Left angles are always facing forward. When facing left, you are at 180 degrees. When facing right, you are at 180 degrees. When facing left, you are at 90 degrees. One should not return to one's starting point from 90 degrees. So, the answer is No.
